datapipes.observer¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Subject()

The Subject interface declares a set of methods for managing subscribers.

ConcreteSubject()

The Subject owns some important state and notifies observers when the state changes.

Observer()

The Observer interface declares the update method, used by subjects.

PubSub()

Publish Subscribe decorator for object instantiated by the Data Factory.

ConcreteObserverA()

The Observer interface declares the update method, used by subjects.

ConcreteObserverB()

The Observer interface declares the update method, used by subjects.
datapipes.observer._LOGGER¶
class datapipes.observer.Subject¶

Bases: abc.ABC

The Subject interface declares a set of methods for managing subscribers.

abstract attach(self, observer: Observer)¶

Attach an observer to the subject.

abstract detach(self, observer: Observer)¶

Detach an observer from the subject.

abstract notify(self)¶

Notify all observers about an event.

class datapipes.observer.ConcreteSubject¶

Bases: datapipes.observer.Subject

The Subject owns some important state and notifies observers when the state changes.

_state :int¶

For the sake of simplicity, the Subject’s state, essential to all subscribers, is stored in this variable.

_observers :List['Observer'] = []¶

List of subscribers. In real life, the list of subscribers can be stored more comprehensively (categorized by event type, etc.).

attach(self, observer: Observer)¶

Attach an observer to the subject.

detach(self, observer: Observer)¶

Detach an observer from the subject.

notify(self)¶

Trigger an update in each subscriber.

notify_one(self, observer: Observer = None)¶

Trigger an update in a specific subscriber.

dataReady(self)¶

I can see this being used for basic munging of data once it’s gathered from different sources. Or perhaps there are summary views of data that actually make sense to have here, like a report of what you’re subscribing to.

Could this be the algorithm code? It’s the algorithm that’s a ConcreteSubject of interest by others, and it attaches, detaches, and notifies people of it’s changes…

Usually, the subscription logic is only a fraction of what a Subject can really do. Subjects commonly hold some important business logic, that triggers a notification method whenever something important is about to happen (or after it).

class datapipes.observer.PubSub¶

Publish Subscribe decorator for object instantiated by the Data Factory.

detach(self, observer: Observer)¶

dataReady(self)¶

I can see this being used for basic munging of data once it’s gathered from different sources. Or perhaps there are summary views of data that actually make sense to have here, like a report of what you’re subscribing to.

Could this be the algorithm code? It’s the algorithm that’s a ConcreteSubject of interest by others, and it attaches, detaches, and notifies people of it’s changes…
